page.title: 04Springburn Health Centre
page.content: The Centre,opened in 1982,cares for up to 30000 persons.Appointments are made by people to see one of the 24 doctors in 7 practices.People are registered with one of the doctors in a practice but can have attention from any doctor in the same practice.Patients are seen in one of the 19 consulting rooms and, if needed,be attended to by a nurse in a treatment room.Prescriptions are dis -pensed by a pharmacist in the Centre. Other health services are available. There are dentists,dental hygienists, chiropodists,physiotherapists,district nurses,mid-wives,health visitors and a social worker.An administrator and her deputy are in charge of the many other duties performed.There is a reception area.Clerical staff,including night filing-clerks,attend to the great mass of medical documents and records.There is a 24 hour manned telephone service.
